title: PHPExceptiongetMessage() Method

metadata.description: Learn about PHPExceptiongetMessage() Method with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Throw an exception and then output its message:
<?php
try {
throw new Exception("An error occurred");
} 
  catch(Exception $e) {
echo $e->getMessage();
}
?>

Definition and Usage
The
getMessage()
method returns a description of the error or behaviour that caused the exception to be thrown.
Syntax
$exception->getMessage()
Technical Details
Return Value:
Returns a string
Related Pages
Read more about Exceptions in our
PHP Exceptions Chapter
.
